三人遣い: (さんにんづかい) - three-person operation of a puppet (bunraku)
三代: (さんだい) - three generations/three periods; third generation
三代実録: (さんだいじつろく) - Sandai Jitsuroku (sixth of the six classical Japanese history texts)
三位: (さんい) - third rank (in the Japanese court system); trinity (Christianity)/the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit
三体: (さんたい) - the three character styles: square and semicursive and grass
三体問題: (さんたいもんだい) - the three-body problem
三倍満: (さんばいまん) - {mahj}  win worth 24000 points (or, if dealer, 36000 points)
三元色: (さんげんしょく) - three primary colors (colours); trichromatic
三光: (さんこう) - (in hanafuda) a collection of three non-rain light cards
三光作戦: (さんこうさくせん) - (三光 is a ref. to a Chinese phrase meaning 'kill all, burn all, loot all') Three Alls Strategy; Japanese scorched earth policy during the second Sino-Japanese War
三光鳥: (サンコウチョウ) - Japanese paradise flycatcher (Terpsiphone atrocaudata)
三八: (さんぱち) - three and eight; Arisaka Type 38 rifle
三八式歩兵銃: (さんぱちしきほへいじゅう) - Arisaka Type 38 rifle
三公: (さんこう) - three lords (highest ranking officials in the old Imperial Chinese or Japanese governments)
三公社五現業: (さんこうしゃごげんぎょう) - three public corporations (Japan National Railways, Japan Monopoly Corporation, and Nippon Telegraph and Telephone) and five government enterprises (postal services, mintage, printing, management of state-owned forests-fields, and monopolization of alcohol)
三具足: (みつぐそく) - three implements for worship (incense burner, flower vase and candle-stand)
三冠王: (さんかんおう) - {baseb} winner of triple crown
三冠馬: (さんかんば) - winner of Japan's three main horse races
三分の一: (さんぶんのいち) - one third; a third part
三割自治: (さんわりじち) - the "thirty-percent autonomy" of local governments
三化螟蛾: (サンカメイガ) - yellow stem borer (species of moth, Scirpophaga incertulas)
三十一日: (さんじゅういちにち) - thirty-first day of the month; thirty-one days
三十三回忌: (さんじゅうさんかいき) - 32nd anniversary of death
三十三所: (さんじゅうさんしょ) - any of a number of sets of thirty-three holy places enshrining Avalokitesvara (esp. those comprising a popular pilgrimage in the Kinki region)
三十三才: (ミソサザイ) - (also written with the ateji 三十三才) winter wren (Troglodytes troglodytes)
三十二分音符: (さんじゅうにぶおんぷ) - {music} 32nd note; demisemiquaver
三十八度線: (さんじゅうはちどせん) - the Thirty-eighth Parallel
三十六字母: (さんじゅうろくじぼ) - 36 Initials (system for transcribing initial consonants of Middle Chinese)
三十六計: (さんじゅうろっけい) - (yoji) the 36 (ancient Chinese military) strategies (of which the last resort was said to be beating a retreat)
三十六計逃げるにしかず: (さんじゅうろっけいにげるにしかず) - the smartest thing in a tight situation is to beat a retreat
三十六計逃げるに如かず: (さんじゅうろっけいにげるにしかず) - the smartest thing in a tight situation is to beat a retreat
三十年戦争: (さんじゅうねんせんそう) - the Thirty Years' War
三十日: (さんじゅうにち) - thirtieth day of the month; thirty days
三十日蕎麦: (みそかそば) - soba eaten at the end of the month (esp. at the end of the year)
三十番神: (さんじゅうばんじん) - the thirty guardian deities (a different one for each day)
三千世界: (さんぜんせかい) - (yoji) the whole world; the universe
三千大千世界: (さんぜんだいせんせかい) - the whole universe (of a billion worlds) that Buddha enlightened
三単現: (さんたんげん) - third person singular present
三卿: (さんきょう) - three secondary Tokugawa branch families (Tayasu, Shimizu, and Hitotsubashi)
三原色: (さんげんしょく) - three primary colors (colours); trichromatic
三又槍魚: (ミツマタヤリウオ) - Pacific blackdragon (Idiacanthus antrostomus)
三叉神経痛: (さんさしんけいつう) - trigeminal neuralgia
三叉路: (さんさろ) - three-forked road; junction of three roads
三合会: (さんごうかい) - Triad (secret Chinese society usually associated with organized crime)
三名山: (さんめいざん) - Japan's Three Famous Mountains (Mt. Fuji, Mt. Tate and Mt. Haku)
三后: (さんこう) - Grand Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager and the Empress Consort
三味線: (さみせん) - shamisen; samisen; three-stringed Japanese lute
三味線の駒: (しゃみせんのこま) - bridge of shamisen
三味線貝: (シャミセンガイ) - lingulate brachiopod (esp. species Lingula anatina)
三和土: (タタキ) - (叩き, 敲き, タタキ only) mince (minced meat or fish); (叩き, 敲き only)  seared skipjack tuna; (叩き, 敲き only)  robbery/extortion; (usu. 三和土 ) hard-packed dirt (clay, gravel, etc.) floor/concrete floor; (叩き, タタキ only) whipping/lashing/bashing/beating/flaming
三唱: (さんしょう) - three cheers; three chants; singing three times
三嘆: (さんたん) - deep admiration; repeatedly lamenting
三回忌: (さんかいき) - second anniversary of a death
三回生: (さんかいせい) - third year (college) student; junior
三因: (さんいん) - three causes of Buddha nature
三因仏性: (さんいんぶっしょう) - three causes of Buddha nature
三国: (さんごく) - three countries; Japan, China & India/Japan, Korea & China/all the world; Three Kingdoms (of ancient China: Wei, Shu, Wu)
三国一: (さんごくいち) - unparalleled in Japan and China and India (unparallelled)
三国人: (さんこくじん) - national of a third country; foreigner resident in Japan (esp. Chinese and Korean)
三国同盟: (さんごくどうめい) - triple alliance
三国干渉: (さんごくかんしょう) - Triple Intervention (diplomatic intervention by Russia, Germany and France over the terms of the Treaty of Shimonoseki)
三国志: (さんごくし) - Annals of the Three Kingdoms
三国時代: (さんごくじだい) - Three Kingdoms period (of Chinese history, 220-280 CE); Three Kingdoms period (of Korean history, 4th-7th centuries CE)
三士: (さんし) - recruit (former rank in the JSDF)
三大国: (さんだいこく) - the Big Three (countries)
三大洋: (さんたいよう) - three great oceans (Pacific, Atlantic and Indian)
